Posts.Content: Hi! Thanks for the Welcome. I meant to include his Gleason score which is a 5. He's presently having tests done should know more in a week. I know he took the CT test with contrast. I'll try to post more as I know
Posts.Signature: Male:Age 39 at diagnosis 10-18-2013 First diagnoses DLBCL-Presented as a dental cysts/tumor 10-31-2013: PET and CT scans show localized sinus involvement 3cm tumor 11-13-2013 Bone Marrow Negative 11-14-2013 Staged as 1E- Extranodal localized minimum to no node involvement 11-30-2013 Started 6 Cycles RCHOP, 4 Lumbar Punctures of Methotrexate 12-20-2013 Mid Treatment pet shows good response to RCHOP 2-28-2014 RCHOP Complete 3-20-2014 Followup PET/Radiation Simulation. PET shows no spreading, minimal uptake at the original tumor site and a small amount of residual disease 4-1-2014 Radiation begins 20 sessions to kill the beast 4-18-2014 Radiation half done. Dry mouth, minor skin irritation and fatigue 5-10-2014 Radiation Complete, lingering sinus issues and pain, dry mucus some loss of smell 6-19-2014 PET-CT scan to asses response to treatment(fingers crossed) 7-1-2014 NED-Officially in remission 3-17-2015 NED 11-20-2015 NED 6-1-2016-NED
Posts.Title: Father Diagnosed

Posts.Content: Hi all. I'm new to this forum but not to this site or cancerous diseases. I'm currently personally battling Non Hodgkin's lymphoma, DLBCL. All the info is in my signature. I just found out my dad has prostate cancer( after losing my mother to DLBCL 20 years ago) good times huh? Well my dads doctor said he wasn't going to do surgery but most likely would do radiation and or irradiated prongs inserted near the site. His doc said it's a small "spot" a d was caught really early. Can anyone here give me greater detail on these treatments as I know nothing about this cancer I'm more lymphoma expert. Thanks -Sean
